channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-9549] WebHdfsFileSystem hangs on close()
item.description: When close() is called via fs shoutdown hook, the synchronized method, removeRenewAction() hangs. This is because DelegationTokenRenewer calls DelayQueue.take() inside a synchronized block. Since this is a blocking call, it hangs forever.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Here is relevant stack trace:

"Thread-2" prio=10 tid=0x0000000014159800 nid=0x5724 waiting for monitor entry [0x00000000421a7000]
java.lang.Thread.State: BLOCKED (on object monitor)
at org.apache.hadoop.fs.DelegationTokenRenewer.removeRenewAction(DelegationTokenRenewer.java:191)

  • waiting to lock <0x00000000ffab04b0> (a org.apache.hadoop.fs.DelegationTokenRenewer)
    at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.web.WebHdfsFileSystem.close(WebHdfsFileSystem.java:825)
    at org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem$Cache.closeAll(FileSystem.java:2402)
  • locked <0x00000000ffac8210> (a org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem$Cache)
    at org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem$Cache$ClientFinalizer.run(FileSystem.java:2419)
  • locked <0x00000000ffac8200> (a org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem$Cache$ClientFinalizer)
    at org.apache.hadoop.util.ShutdownHookManager$1.run(ShutdownHookManager.java:54)

"FileSystem-DelegationTokenRenewer" daemon prio=10 tid=0x0000000013f9b800 nid=0x5723 waiting on condition [0x00000000420a6000]
java.lang.Thread.State: TIMED_WAITING (parking)
at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)

  • parking to wait for <0x00000000ffab0530> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject)
    at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.parkNanos(LockSupport.java:226)
    at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.awaitNanos(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:2082)
    at java.util.concurrent.DelayQueue.take(DelayQueue.java:220)
    at org.apache.hadoop.fs.DelegationTokenRenewer.run(DelegationTokenRenewer.java:215)
  • locked <0x00000000ffab04b0> (a org.apache.hadoop.fs.DelegationTokenRenewer)
The synchronize around queue.take() was added by HADOOP-9049.
This also bug prevents the use of multiple webhdfs instances since the 2nd blocks when a token is acquired.
Should we revert HADOOP-9049 or make an additional change on top of it to fix the issue?
Bug is actually in the less-than-ideal token renewer in common that is bolted onto hftp and webhdfs.

The problem is the unnecessary synchronization on the thread-safe DelayQueue. The daemon thread synched while trying to take from the queue. This manifested as two problems:

  1. After creating a filesystem, the thread was blocked waiting for the token in the queue to be ready for renewal. Closing the fs and removing the token blocked on the queue waiting for the thread to renew the token. It would have "worked" when the token renewed after about 21 hours...
  2. Creating another webhdfs and/or hftp instance would block trying to add its token to the queue while the thread waited for the 1st fs token to be ready for renewal.

The synch on the queue was to allow removal of tokens by iterating the queue. The queue needed to be iterated, versus calling remove, because the RenewAction objects improperly implemented hashCode and equals.

I had a much cleaner overall implementation but it required changes to webhdfs and hftp. This patch should be good enough for now. I also added a bunch of missing tests.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12582126/HADOOP-9549.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 1 new or modified test files.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 eclipse:eclipse. The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 1 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common.

+1 contrib tests. The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/2522//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/2522//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshadoop-common.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/2522//console

This message is automatically generated.
The findbug warning is on a method marked @VisibleForTesting only, so please review and I'll update the patch soon.
Add synch to the reset method that is only used by tests.

+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12582154/HADOOP-9549.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 1 new or modified test files.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 eclipse:eclipse. The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common.

+1 contrib tests. The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/2523//testReport/

I've committed this to trunk and branch-2. Thanks for the patch, Daryn.
